Before the MIT professor did his study, Headsmart Labs (http://www.headsmartlabs.com/ ) did a study that showed that the Ideal Gas Law explained the deflation issue. So now there are two independent studies that come to that same conclusion.

The NFL conveniently ignored the Headsmart Labs analysis, which was done before the NFL hired lawyers to generate a half-baked report.

The "more probable than not" standard is the rule under civil litigation, but for criminal law (which is what the NFL is trying to assert, that is that this was CHEATING, BREAKING THE RULES, basically a criminal act) the standrad is "beyond a reasonable doubt." Clearly, the science shows that there is no way one would find an offense "beyond a reasonable doubt" but Goodell in his $44 million a year "wisdom" decided on a penalty anyway.

I am rooting for the Patriots to beat Payton Manning and the Broncos and to go on to win the Superbowl.

All of the crybabies who hate the Patriots are a bunch of sore losers.

Go Patriots.
